channel.title: ERP-UI - UI for ERP Bounded Domains on tangly Components
channel.description: Recent content in ERP-UI - UI for ERP Bounded Domains on tangly Components

item.title: Readme
item.description: Purpose The tangly erp ui bounded domain component provides regular business model abstractions for business applications written in Java. The component is using records and requires Java 21 LTS or higher. Try it out. Download and Documentation Include the library in your Maven configuration as: <dependency> <groupId>net.tangly.erp</groupId> <artifactId>ui</artifactId> <version>0.2.7</version> </dependency> Include the library in your Gradle configuration as: implementation "net.tangly.erp:ui:0.2.7" The documentation can be found under Business documentation. For any further questions, you can use the forum tangly-Discussions.

item.title: Release Notes
item.description: UI Library Change Logs This document provides a high-level view of the changes introduced in the ERP UI library by release. For a detailed view of what has changed, refer to the repository commits. 0.2.7 (2024-05-31) Update of library dependencies, update to JDK-21, and modern Gradle approach to build solutions 0.2.6 (2021-08-31) Initial version of the library packed as a DDD bounded domain Requires Java 16 or higher due to extensive usage of records and sealed classes

item.title: Smoke Tests
item.description: Smoke Tests The goal is to test the ERP functionalities in a quick and efficient way. The smoke tests are a subset of the test cases that are run on the ERP system to ensure that the most crucial functions of a program work. The smoke tests are run to determine if the ERP system is stable and can be used for further testing. The tests are: Login to the ERP system with the default user
